arModelDescription: Discover the remarkable story of Lucy, a fossilized skeleton of a hominid species called Australopithecus afarensis. Lucy, discovered in Ethiopia in 1974, is one of the most complete early human skeletons ever found. She lived over 3 million years ago and provides crucial insights into human evolution. Explore her ancient world and learn about her lifestyle, habitat, and significance in our evolutionary history. Join us on a journey back in time to uncover the mysteries of our human ancestors. Lucy's discovery revolutionized our understanding of human origins and continues to inspire scientists and enthusiasts worldwide.
